Bertemu Sekjen PBB, Jokowi Bahas Isu Rakhine State dan Palestina
03 Nov 2019, 02:02 by Friski Riana, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi membahas isu krisis kemanusiaan di Rakhine State (Myanmar) dan Palestina dengan Sekretaris Jenderal Perserikatan Bangsa-Bangsa (PBB), António Guterres, saat pertemuan bilateral keduanya selepas sesi Pleno KTT ke-35 ASEAN.
Dalam pertemuan yang berlangsung di Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand, pada Sabtu, 2 November 2019, Presiden menyampaikan pandangannya terkait situasi terkini terhadap dua isu tersebut. Tak hanya itu, Jokowi juga menyatakan kesiapan Indonesia untuk turut berkontribusi bagi upaya penyelesaian masalah.
"Presiden menyampaikan observasinya terhadap dua isu tersebut. Sekali lagi, Indonesia secara aktif bersedia, more than ready, untuk berkontribusi dalam upaya penyelesaian dua masalah yang tidak mudah itu," ujar Menteri Luar Negeri Retno Marsudi dalam siaran tertulis Biro Pers, Media, dan Informasi Sekretariat Presiden, Ahad, 3 November 2019.
Sekjen PBB mengapresiasi langkah Jokowi atas kontribusi Indonesia dalam upaya penyelesaian dua isu tersebut. Meski situasi di Rakhine State dan Palestina hingga kini masih belum menemui hasil yang diharapkan, baik Jokowi dan Sekjen PBB memiliki pandangan yang sama bahwa seluruh pihak tetap harus menjaga asa bagi penyelesaian krisis tersebut.
"Kita tidak boleh putus asa. Kita harus terus berusaha karena dua-duanya pada akhirnya menyangkut masalah kemanusiaan," ucap Retno.
Selama pertemuan bilateral tersebut, Jokowi didampingi oleh Menteri Koordinator Bidang Politik, Hukum, dan Keamanan Mahfud MD, Menko Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto, Menteri Perdagangan Agus Suparmanto, dan Sekretaris Kabinet Pramono Anung.
text:
Meet the UN Secretary General, Jokowi Discusses Rakhine State and Palestine Issues
03 Nov 2019, 02:02 by Friski Riana, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo or Jokowi discussed the issue of the humanitarian crisis in Rakhine State (Myanmar) and Palestine with the Secretary General of the United Nations (UN), António Guterres, during their bilateral meetings after the ASEAN 35th Plenary Session.
In a meeting that took place at the Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand, on Saturday, November 2, 2019, the President expressed his views regarding the current situation on these two issues. Not only that, Jokowi also stated Indonesia's readiness to contribute to efforts to solve the problem.
"The president conveyed his observations on these two issues. Once again, Indonesia is actively willing, more than ready, to contribute to efforts to resolve these two difficult problems," Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi said in a written release of the Press, Media and Information Bureau Presidential Secretariat, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
The UN Secretary General appreciated Jokowi's step on Indonesia's contribution in the effort to resolve the two issues. Although the situation in Rakhine State and Palestine has still not met the expected results, both Jokowi and the UN Secretary General have the same view that all parties must maintain hope for the resolution of the crisis.
"We must not despair. We must keep on trying because both of them ultimately involve humanity issues," said Retno.
During the bilateral meeting, Jokowi was accompanied by the Coordinating Minister for Political, Legal and Security Affairs Mahfud MD, Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto, Trade Minister Agus Suparmanto, and Cabinet Secretary Pramono Anung.
